intro: Hieracium garnense, commonly known as the Garnish Hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellowish-orange composite flowers and is typically found in meadows and grassy areas. The plant has basal leaves that are often hairy and have a rough texture. It produces numerous small florets arranged in a composite head, which is a common feature among plants in the Asteraceae family. Hieracium garnense is often considered a weed in agricultural settings due to its rapid growth and ability to spread easily.
